bibl.title: Letter from Luis B. Pogolotti to Philip Showalter Hench, October 18, 1940

div1.p: Pogolotti advises Hench to purchase the shack and then present it to the Cuban government when restored. He discusses the possibility of raising a monument on the site.

div1.head: Letter from Luis B. Pogolotti to Philip Showalter Hench, October 18, 1940

opener.dateline:
Marianao Oct 18th 1940 Dr. P. S. Hench
Rochester,
New adress
Cuba 105
Habana

div1.p:
I answer to two of letters
of yours I received today.

One is dated “Monday afternoon
10-14-40- and the other Oct. 15-1940

Good service indeed and hope
this will reach you at Rochester.

I approved that you should
be the person to own the shack
and present it to the Cuban Gover
nement restored, but it has to
be taken away from where it is
now, because that place is a quarry
where to blastings with dynamite
is frequent for the business.

It is at almost at 1500 feet
from main road, in rather
solitary place, where sabotage and
others things could happen with
time. On the very spot the #1 is
now, the owner might be willing
to allow to build some strong
concrete columns united by
an ornamental iron chain more
or less like next page sketch
Everything has to be
strong taking for granted
that people will let
goats and w cows pasture
around unless a house
is built and somebody
in charge with some one
with certain responsability.
If monuments in cities sometimes
are neglected !!!!

No matter how small the piece
of land around be bought, or even
given by the present owner, we
must keep in mind that the
“Lazear Camp” should be kept for
centuries and would be in the
way for future developments of the place

I don't think would be wise to
try to obtain from the Rojas family
the to place #1 at the front of the
place. Not only for the looks but
also if the property should be sold.

A bronze memorial at the corner
would be very good, also mentioning
Mrs Rojas permission to place the Camp there

So by elimination I come to the
3rd alternative of yours: To place it in the false Camp.

but There could be cared for by the organi
sation that sooner or later will be made
of the- Finlay. Memorial. For the 4th Sept. Hospital
and for Camp. Columbia and that the land
is a property of the Cuban government, and there
is where Dr. Lazear died. If I can be usefull
to that ideal, don't hesitate and order!!
I am only too glad to work for it.
